intro: Serissa ceylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon serissa, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka and southern India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has small, glossy, dark green leaves and a compact, bushy growth habit. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Serissa ceylanica is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
